snippet: Cardinal Timothy M. Dolan announced the names of 55 parishes that will merge with neighboring parishes from Staten Island to the Catskills.
abstract: Roman Catholic Archdiocese of New York, in largest reorganization of its history, will merge 31 parishes into neighboring parishes and close the churches for regular services; another 24 parishes will merge with neighboring ones, but their churches will remain open; shift has been long in coming, reflecting demographic trends that have plagued Roman Catholic dioceses across much of the nation for decades.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Sandra E. Garcia, Kate Pastor, Liz Robbins, Nate Schweber and Vivian Yee.

lead_paragraph: Cardinal Timothy M. Dolan announced the names of 55 parishes that will merge with neighboring parishes from Staten Island to the Catskills.

headline.main: Heartache for New York’s Catholics as Church Closings Are Announced
headline.print_headline: Tears for New York’s Catholics as Church Closings Are Announced
